intro: Psychotria aquatica subsp. aquatica, commonly known as water psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its aquatic or semi-aquatic growth habit, often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of freshwater bodies. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. Psychotria aquatica subsp. aquatica is noted for its ecological importance in supporting aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
